TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ParallelMergeOptions extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the preferred type of *output merge* to use in a query. In other words, it indicates how PLINQ should merge the results from the various partitions back into a single result sequence. This is a hint only, and may not be respected by the system when parallelizing all queries.This is a hint only, and may not be respected by the system when parallelizing all queries.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use `NotBuffered` para las consultas que se usan y de salida como secuencias, esto tiene la latencia más baja entre la ejecución de la consulta de inicio y los elementos que se produjo.Use `NotBuffered` for queries that will be consumed and output as streams, this has the lowest latency between beginning query execution and elements being yielded. Para algunas consultas, como las que implican a una ordenación (OrderBy, OrderByDescending), el almacenamiento en búfer es esencial y una sugerencia de NotBuffered o AutoBuffered se pasará por alto.For some queries, such as those involving a sort (OrderBy, OrderByDescending), buffering is essential and a hint of NotBuffered or AutoBuffered will be ignored. Sin embargo, se pueden transmitir las consultas que se crean mediante el operador AsOrdered siempre y cuando ninguna ordenación se realiza dentro de la propia consulta.However, queries that are created by using the AsOrdered operator can be streamed as long as no further sorting is performed within the query itself. Use `AutoBuffered` para la mayoría de los casos; esto es el valor predeterminado.Use `AutoBuffered` for most cases; this is the default. Consigue un equilibrio entre la latencia y el rendimiento general.It strikes a balance between latency and overall performance. Use `FullyBuffered` para las consultas cuando se puede procesar el resultado completo antes de que la información es necesaria.Use `FullyBuffered` for queries when the entire output can be processed before the information is needed. Esta opción ofrece el mejor rendimiento cuando toda la salida se puede acumular antes de producir toda la información, aunque no es adecuado para el flujo de procesamiento o mostrando parcial resultados de consulta intermedio.This option offers the best performance when all of the output can be accumulated before yielding any information, though it is not suitable for stream processing or showing partial results mid-query.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions AutoBuffered = int32(2)

summary.span: Use a merge with output buffers of a size chosen by the system.

span.span: Use a merge with output buffers of a size chosen by the system.

summary.span: Results will accumulate into an output buffer before they are available to the consumer of the query.

span.span: Results will accumulate into an output buffer before they are available to the consumer of the query.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions Default = int32(0)

summary.span: Use the default merge type, which is AutoBuffered.

span.span: Use the default merge type, which is AutoBuffered.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions FullyBuffered = int32(3)

summary.span: Use a merge with full output buffers.

span.span: Use a merge with full output buffers.

summary.span: The system will accumulate all of the results before making any of them available to the consumer of the query.

span.span: The system will accumulate all of the results before making any of them available to the consumer of the query.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Linq.ParallelMergeOptions NotBuffered = int32(1)

summary.span: Use a merge without output buffers.

span.span: Use a merge without output buffers.

summary.span: As soon as result elements have been computed, make that element available to the consumer of the query.

span.span: As soon as result elements have been computed, make that element available to the consumer of the query.
